intro: Securidaca macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with milky sap. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
